alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 4:37PM EDT until April 07 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near East Juliette affecting Jones County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Falling Creek near East Juliette. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM EDT Thursday was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 10.1 feet late this evening. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
